column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Row-rooth has something to ask you.
Speak with Row-rooth.
While transfigured, read the epitaphs.
Speak with Row-rooth.
While transfigured, read the epitaph.
Speak with Row-rooth.
I have a question─one that can only be answered by a being of flesh and bone. Will you hear it?
Thank you. Before I ask, however, I require that you learn more of my kind, lest your answer be senseless and vapid.
You can come to know us through our final words─though, alas, you cannot comprehend them in your corporeal form.
Thus, I shall temporarily free you from your body, allowing you to perceive as we Ea do. Please indicate when you are ready to shuffle off your mortal coil.
You have prepared, yes? Very well. After you have been liberated, I ask that you read three epitaphs ere returning to me.
Please brace yourself, as there is the recorded evidence that this may “feel weird”...
In order to progress, you must complete the objectives while transfigured.
You will return from your transfigured status if you move too far away. Look to your map for the transfiguration's area of effect.
If necessary, speak with Row-rooth to restore the transfiguration.
I ask that you read three epitaphs, then return to me.
Tragically, your spirit has re-entered your body. Permit me to free you once more.
Something is written here in an unfamiliar script. You cannot read it as you are.
In order to progress, you must be under the transfigured status.

(-Epitaph-)I grasp eternity, yet I hold only loss.
If forever has an end,
Why has it not come?

(-Epitaph-)With no future, we turn to the past,
Knowing none have turned to our present.
We are the dead end.
You have read them? This is well. However, you have yet to look upon our most important text. Please seek it in the charming wooded area outside our home.
Please seek our most important text amidst the memory of trees. I do not know how to make this any clearer.

(-Epitaph-)The price of eternity is joy;
Its gift, unending sorrow.
So you have read all that was left behind...
Those inscriptions were written by the first of our kind. The first to know the pinnacle of enlightenment, and the first to know the depths of despair.
They have prepared you to answer my question. As someone bound to a corporeal form, do you think there is hope to be found in life?
What will you say?
Of course there's hope!
The only way to know is to keep living.
Strange... But perhaps it is precisely that spongy form which allows you to cling to the intangible unto death. How fortunate for you.
Fascinating... It must be precisely that spongy form which allows you to cling to the intangible unto death. How fortunate for you.
Fascinating... It appears that embarking on that quest for hope and seeing it to its ultimate conclusion is a sort of corporeal privilege.
Fascinating... Though your flesh is spongy and weak, it gives you the strength to live in pursuit of hope.
That was most edifying. Creatures of flesh enjoy shiny tokens, do they not? Please have some as thanks.
...Ah, yes. I shall return you to your body, as it seems you are fond of it.
